title: Barbara Jordan Health Policy Scholars
text: The Barbara Jordan Health Policy Scholars Program was a health policy internship program sponsored by the <a href="Kaiser%20Family%20Foundation">Kaiser Family Foundation</a> from 2000 to 2012. The program was based at <a href="Howard%20University">Howard University</a> and sponsored an annual group of senior undergraduates and recent graduates to work in <a href="U.S.%20Congress">U.S. Congress</a> offices and learn about health policy. It was named in honor of <a href="Barbara%20Jordan">Barbara Jordan</a>, the first <a href="Black%20people">black</a> woman elected from the U.S. South to the <a href="House%20of%20Representatives">House of Representatives</a>, and a former <a href="trustee">trustee</a> of the Kaiser Family Foundation. Its goal was to expand the number of <a href="Person%20of%20color">people of color</a> in the healthy policy field. Over 170 people participated in the program over its course. The last class was in 2012.
